messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: MIAMI POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION DIVISION
Auto Theft Unit
SIGNAL: 66T
ITEM NUMBER: T-66048-19
PAGE 22 of 48
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Daniel Martinez
Sgt. Emily Rodriguez
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Carlos Sanchez
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Lisa Thompson
Sgt. Michael Johnson
( Special Investigations Unit)
Det. Anthony Garcia
Det. Rebecca Lee
( Special Investigations Unit)
Det. Laura Anderson
( Special Investigations Unit)
Det. Richard King
Det. Jessica Morales
(General Assignment)
Det. Samuel Peterson
(Property Crimes Section)
Det. Natalie White
(Organized Crime Section)
VICTIM:
JOHN DOE, male, date of birth 01/15/1972.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
12 DECEMBER 2019 at around 7:45 PM in the Wynwood area.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Carlos Sanchez
3789
The case progressed amid a web of elusive leads and partially erased security footage. Officer Blake, on regular patrol in Wynwood, was among the first to notice the stolen vehicle. Accompanied by Sgt. Lisa Thompson and Patrol Officer Davis, they coordinated an initial search. Technician Murphy, adept in vehicle forensics, was tasked with analyzing the car. Criminalist Edwards, meticulously examining the available evidence, identified a unique tool mark that was key in tracing the vehicle's history. Coroner Dr. Foster was consulted to examine an unrelated case in the vicinity, which unexpectedly yielded information crucial to the auto theft case. Patrol Officer Green, collaborating with local auto shops, pieced together evidence that led to the identification of a suspect.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Daniel Martinez Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Auto Theft Unit. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. Emily Rodriguez Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Martinez. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Carlos Sanchez Officer Context: Lead investigator of the auto theft case, also served as the reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Lisa Thompson Officer Context: Assisted in coordinating the initial search, part of the Special Investigations Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Michael Johnson Officer Context: Special Investigations Unit sergeant, supported the operation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Anthony Garcia Officer Context: Special Investigations Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Rebecca Lee Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Special Investigations Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Laura Anderson Officer Context: Special Investigations Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Richard King Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Jessica Morales Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the auto theft case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Samuel Peterson Officer Context: Property Crimes Section detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Natalie White Officer Context: Organized Crime Section detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Blake Officer Context: First to notice the stolen vehicle during regular patrol in Wynwood. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Davis Officer Context: Assisted in coordinating an initial search for the stolen vehicle. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Murphy Officer Context: Specialized in vehicle forensics, analyzed the stolen car. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Edwards Officer Context: Analyzed evidence, identified a unique tool mark on the vehicle. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Foster Officer Context: Examined an unrelated case, provided crucial information for the auto theft case. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Green Officer Context: Collaborated with local auto shops, aiding in suspect identification. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
